description: From Yandruwandha bijirri, and its source, Pitta-Pitta pijiri.

entries.meaning: The prepared leaves of an Australian shrub, Duboisia hopwoodii, chewed as a stimulant by Aboriginal Australians; also the shrub itself. [from 19th c.]
examples: Winston rolled his head and eyes from side to side, like a man ‘on’ pitjuri.
